org.cambillaum.concurrencyutils.testing

Class ConcurrentTester

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cambillaum.concurrencyutils.testing.ConcurrentTester

  • public class ConcurrentTester
extends Object
    A class that allows you to reproduce concurrency issues in unit tests. When you spot a concurrency problem in your application, you can use this class to reproduce it in a unit test. Once you introduce synchronization mechanisms in your application to fix your program your unit test may jam in a deadlock situation. You can solve this problem by using the version of the waitForOtherThreads() method that accepts a timeout as an argument. Here is a usage example which reproduces a racing condition: 
     Account account = new Account(1000L);
 ConcurrentTester concurrentTester = new ConcurrentTester();
 WaitingCondition waitingCondition = new WaitingCondition(2);
 Runnable runnable = new Runnable() {
            public void run() {
                try {
                    long oldBalance = account.getBalance();
                    concurrentTester.waitForOtherThreads(waitingCondition);
                    long newBalance = oldBalance + 100;
                    account.setBalance(newBalance);
                } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
                    throw new RuntimeException(ex);
                }
            }
 };
 concurrentTester.addRunnables(this.runnable, this.runnable).execute();
 assertEquals(1100L, account.getBalance());
    Author:
    Mathieu Cambillau

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ConcurrentTester addRunnable(Runnable runnable)
      Adds a Runnable to be executed by this ConcurrentTester.
      ConcurrentTester addRunnables(Collection<Runnable> runnables)
      Adds a collection of Runnable to be executed by this ConcurrentTester.
      ConcurrentTester addRunnables(Runnable runnable, Runnable... runnables)
      Adds several Runnable to be executed by this ConcurrentTester using varargs.
      void execute()
      Executes the runnables, taking care of the waiting conditions and timeouts.
      void waitForOtherThreads(WaitingCondition wc1)
      Sets a WaitingCondition point where runnables invoking waitForOtherThreads on the same WaitingCondition have to wait for each other before continuing processing.
      void waitForOtherThreads(WaitingCondition waitingCondition, long timeout, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Sets a WaitingCondition point where runnables invoking waitForOtherThreads on the same WaitingCondition have to wait for each other for at least the amount of time defined by the given timeout before continuing processing.

                            Runnable... runnables)

      • waitForOtherThreads

        public void waitForOtherThreads(WaitingCondition waitingCondition,
                       long timeout,
                       TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets a WaitingCondition point where runnables invoking waitForOtherThreads on the same WaitingCondition have to wait for each other for at least the amount of time defined by the given timeout before continuing processing.
        Parameters:
        waitingCondition - the waitingCondition on which the runnables have to wait.
        timeout - the timeout.
        timeUnit - the timeout unit.

      • waitForOtherThreads

        public void waitForOtherThreads(WaitingCondition wc1)
        Sets a WaitingCondition point where runnables invoking waitForOtherThreads on the same WaitingCondition have to wait for each other before continuing processing.
        Parameters:
        wc1 - the waitingCondition on which the runnables have to wait.

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Executes the runnables, taking care of the waiting conditions and timeouts.
